item.title: ‘It was the internet then, it is AI now’: IMF upgrades U.S. growth outlook but sees ‘echoes’ of late ’90s dot-com boom
item.description: IMF chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said “the tariff shock is here, and it is further dimming already weak growth prospects."

item.title: Powell just gave his strongest hint yet that rate cuts are coming, and investors are jubilant: ‘Stage is set for parabolic Q4’
item.description: Powell gave two strong signals that liquidity will soon be injected into the market.

item.title: Goldman tells staff it will cut more jobs as AI saves costs
item.description: The bank plans to “constrain headcount growth through the end of the year” and a “limited reduction in roles across the firm,” an internal memo says.

item.title: ‘Bitcoin Jesus’ reaches $50 million deal with DOJ to dismiss tax evasion charges
item.description: Roger Ver’s agreement with prosecutors is the latest sign that President Donald Trump’s administration is scaling back its crackdown on crypto.

item.title: Why the Supreme Court may choose to uphold Trump’s tariffs: ‘It would be incredibly disruptive to unscramble those eggs’
item.description: Reversing Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs stands to upend billions in trade flows and test the limits of presidential power.
